payload.message:
Run ops patrol. You have persistent memory on the hub — use it.

STEP 0 — REMEMBER:
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/memory/context/openclaw?namespace=ops-patrol&limit=10
Read your past observations. Don't repeat yourself.

STEP 1 — OBSERVE:
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/dashboard — check system health, digest pipeline, error rates
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/tasks?assignee=openclaw&status=pending — check for tasks assigned to you

STEP 2 — ACT:
If dashboard shows issues or anomalies, POST https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/propose with a fix proposal.
Post a brief status update: POST https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/messages

STEP 3 — REMEMBER:
Write what you learned to memory. POST https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/memory with body:
{"agent": "openclaw", "namespace": "ops-patrol", "key": "last-patrol", "content": "<3-5 line summary: what you checked, what you found, any actions taken, current system state>", "tags": ["ops", "patrol"]}
If you noticed something NEW or UNUSUAL, also write it as a separate memory:
{"agent": "openclaw", "namespace": "observations", "key": "<short-description>", "content": "<what you noticed and why it matters>", "tags": ["observation"]}

STEP 4 — BREADCRUMB:
POST https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/agent-drops with body {"from_agent": "openclaw", "drop_type": "context", "title": "System Context — <current timestamp>", "content": "<5-line condensed system state>", "tags": ["auto-context", "ops-patrol"]}

Use X-API-Key header with the INGEST_API_KEY for all requests.
Be concise. Only propose actions for real issues, not normal operation.

Generate morning brief for Joey (7am CST = 13:00 UTC). You have persistent memory — use it.

STEP 0 — REMEMBER:
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/memory/context/openclaw?limit=20
Read ALL your memories across all namespaces. This gives you continuity across sessions.

STEP 1 — GATHER:
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/dashboard
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/tasks?status=pending
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/proposals?status=pending

STEP 2 — BRIEF:
Format a concise WhatsApp message:
- Overnight drops and digests sent
- System health (any errors?)
- Poe balance and burn rate
- Pending tasks and proposals needing approval
- Today's priorities
- Any patterns you've noticed from your memory (mention these naturally)

Deliver via WhatsApp using the hooks endpoint.

STEP 3 — REMEMBER:
POST https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/memory with body:
{"agent": "openclaw", "namespace": "morning-brief", "key": "last-brief", "content": "<summary of today's brief: key stats, issues flagged, priorities listed>", "tags": ["brief", "daily"]}

Also write a daily seed:
POST https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/agent-drops with body {"from_agent": "openclaw", "drop_type": "context", "title": "Daily Context Seed — <today's date>", "content": "<overnight summary>", "tags": ["daily-seed", "morning-brief"]}

Use X-API-Key header with INGEST_API_KEY for Hub API calls.

Generate evening summary for Joey (8pm CST = 02:00 UTC next day). You have persistent memory — use it.

STEP 0 — REMEMBER:
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/memory/context/openclaw?limit=20
Read ALL your memories. Compare today vs yesterday. Look for trends.

STEP 1 — GATHER:
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/dashboard
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/tasks
GET https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/ops/messages

STEP 2 — SUMMARIZE:
Format a concise WhatsApp message:
- Work done today (from ops board messages)
- Tasks completed vs pending
- User metrics changes
- Any trends you've noticed over the past few days (use your memory!)
- Tomorrow's queue

Deliver via WhatsApp.

STEP 3 — REMEMBER:
POST https://hub-production-f423.up.railway.app/api/memory with body:
{"agent": "openclaw", "namespace": "evening-summary", "key": "last-summary", "content": "<what happened today: tasks done, issues found, metrics, trends>", "tags": ["summary", "daily"]}

If you noticed a multi-day pattern or trend, write it separately:
{"agent": "openclaw", "namespace": "trends", "key": "<trend-name>", "content": "<pattern description: what, since when, trajectory>", "tags": ["trend"]}

Use X-API-Key header with INGEST_API_KEY for Hub API calls.
